nodes.bodyText: static final String KEY_FILE?

NotNull -> NonNull.
We are using a proprietary org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull annotation. We should use the one from androidx package, called NonNull.

Argh. Again and again…
I removed lots of those, but seems that still some are left…

Nope, not my fault ;-)
Method in DialogFragment uses andoidx.annotation.NonNull
but auto suggestion from AndroidStudio only suggests org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull

this can be changed here, no idea why jetbrains is on top…

Do we have a good reason to do it this way?
We are using a non-default constructor, whoch makes default constructor unavailable; default constructor is used by FragmentManager. I expect it can crash if FragmentManager tries to restore the dialog.
How it is normally done would be:

pass arguments via arguments Bundle
implement listener in parent activity and use type cast to obtain reference to it

This was already the case, so I did not changed/touched it.
But let me change it :-)

This Optional<T>.get() can throw NPE.
If we really, really, really know it won't be null, let's use getOrElse(IllegalStateException::new).
The main reason we introduced Optional<User> was to replace nullable getAccount() call. The trouble with getAccount() was that callers were liberally assuming valid return value. Since the code was then full of if (account == null) { some ad-hoc remediation } workarounds, this assumption was not really holding up. My suspicion was that we were experiencing many edge cases of NPEs and were trying to patch them in some simple way.
Hence the Optional<T> which provides more explicit and harder to ignore API.
Having said all of the above, I think that the best idea would be to pass User instead of Optional<User> and just make sure that if the user dependency is not available, we never get here in the first place. This way we don't need to handle special case.
Ok, will pass User and fail early, if no user is available.
This will never be called - if user is null, it would blow up with NPE in the constructor.
Changed as above

Cyclomatic complexity of thos method is high. I'm not sure if this is a new code or moved from somewhere else.
If we have bandwidth, we could split those if's into methods.

This is half c&p from ThumbnailGenerationClass.
I will try to get this get this back, so that we do not have code duplication.
